title.narrative: 3.3. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) & ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY

description.narrative: By 2021, there will have been capacity-building of the State and society to rate national policies for water and sanitation in rural areas and manage the risk of disasters based on the implementation of comprehensive environmental management models in rural, indigenous and peri-urban areas, for the priority territories., which contributes to Child Health, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Hygiene, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Sanitation, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Wash And Emergencies, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water Supply, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, children exposed to concerns related to gender, ethnicity, area of residence, living conditions or differences in skills will live in safe environments and have full access to relevant and quality registration, health, nutrition, care, education, water, sanitation and hygiene services that promote their full development.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, there will have been capacity-building of the State and society to rate national policies for water and sanitation inrural areas and manage the risk of disasters based on the implementation of comprehensive environmental management models in rural,indigenous and peri-urban areas, for the priority territories.

description.narrative: To prevent COVID-19, UNICEF distributed hygiene kits and communication messages to 17,801 people from indigenous communities in the Amazon regions. UNICEF and the Ministry of Housing, Construction and Sanitation continued promoting the institutionalization of stand-alone WASH models based on rain collection and dry ecological toilets, already incorporated in the 2021-2025 National WASH Plan. UNICEF provided technical assistance to national Ministries and subnational Governments in Amazon regions to strengthen organized adolescent presence and participation in climate change governance. As part of the advocacy of UNICEF, the Peru government signed COP 21agreement. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2021

baseline.value: There is not official information. Safe schools registration system development in progress.

target.value: 2021:There is an official information system based in infraestructure standards, environment analysis, mitigation measures and a Disaster Risk Reduction Plan.

actual.value: 2021:Due to COVID-19 schools remained close for the year. Only 16% of schools were open during the last quarter of 2021. Safe Schools index improved during 2020 will be an asset for the MoE to support the full school reopening strategy in March 2022.
